main event: A military observer witnessed an oblate, white object turning greenish-blue with a 20-30 ft long trail, flying straight and level in Charleston, South Carolina on May 25, 1953.
interesting points: The object was initially white, then turned greenish-blue, and later back to white.
The object maintained a constant altitude and flight path.
Weather conditions at the time included overcast skies, calm surface winds, and winds aloft up to 45 knots.
The observer was a reliable military source.
sighted object: Oblate, white object turning greenish-blue with a long trail
